ygData.subject: Re: Not really Bard specific
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Your friend is wrong.  My dual wield skill has gotten high enough that it goes off several times in succession.  Last night with a dirk (delay 23, primary)
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 14 Jun 1999, CMai wrote:
>
> Pls tell me if I have been duped but a friend of mine told me that for dual
> wield it does not matter what weapon u have in your secondary hands because
> the speed of your dual wield depends on your primary weapon. So I used a
> combine ls in my primary hand and use a Mino axe in my secondary hand. is
> this true for dual wield?

Your friend is wrong. My dual wield skill has gotten high
enough that it goes off several times in succession. Last
night with a dirk (delay 23, primary) and whip (delay 28,
secondary) equipped, I watched it go off 4 times in
succession. The messages went:

whip
dirk
[pause]
dirk
whip
[pause]
dirk
[pause]
whip
[pause]
dirk
[pause]
dirk
whip

So the two swing independent of each other, each at their own
delay. The minotaur axe and combine longsword have very
similar damage/delay ratios. I wouldn't fret over which one
you have equipped in your primary hand. I would think you'd
want the combine in your primary so you don't have to switch
weapons if you run into a magic-only mob.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
